settings.instructions: Read the questions presented before you and select the best possible answer.
settings.intro: See if you can answer these questions! Good luck, citizen!

problem.question: 1 of 10: What is the name of the national anthem?
2 of 10: Name one of the two longest rivers in the United States.
3 of 10: What do we show loyalty to when we say the Pledge of Allegiance?
4 of 10: In what month do we vote for President?
5 of 10: Name two national U.S. holidays.
problem.choice: a. Valentine's Day and Presidents' Day
b. April Fool's Day and Labor Day
d. Citizenship Day and Columbus Day

problem.question: 6 of 10: Why does the flag have 50 stars?
problem.choice: a. One star for each president
b. One star for each state
d. For the 50 people who originally came to the United States

problem.question: 7 of 10: Name one right only for U.S. citizens.
problem.choice: b. Freedom to attend public school
c. Freedom to run for federal office

problem.question: 8 of 10: What is one responsibility that is only for United States citizens?
9 of 10: What are the two major political parties in the United States?
10 of 10: Why does the flag have 13 stripes?
problem.choice: a. The stripes represent the members of the Second Continental Congress.
b. It was considered lucky to have 13 stripes on the flag.
c. The stripes represent the number of signatures on the U.S. Constitution.
d. The stripes represent the original colonies.
